title: 111_hr5522
content: The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2010 mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2010 requires amendments to Section 4121 of title 5, United States Code, including defining terms like 'interactive,' 'small agency,' and 'supervisor.' The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2010 requires amendments to Section 4121 of title 5, United States Code, including a program to provide training to supervisors on actions, options, and strategies for developing goals, mentoring employees, and improving performance. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2010 mandates a program for supervisors to improve employee performance, manage unacceptable behavior, address hostile work environments, and provide training on prohibited personnel practices. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2010 requires training programs for supervisors to enhance employee performance, manage behavior, address work environment issues, and provide guidance on prohibited practices. The training includes mentoring for new supervisors and interactive programs for managers in their first year. Within one year of appointment, supervisors must undergo the specified training. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2010 mandates that supervisors complete training programs every 3 years, with credit given for previous training. The Office of Personnel Management can adjust deadlines for completion due to unforeseen circumstances. The Office of Personnel Management is required to submit an annual report to specific committees regarding individuals who received adjusted training schedules. When establishing a training program for small agencies, consultation with the Small Agency Council is necessary. Non-small agencies can use alternative training programs with approval from the Office of Personnel Management. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for agency compliance with supervisor training programs, including assessing effectiveness. The amendments made by this section will take effect one year after the enactment of the Act. The amendments made by this section will take effect one year after the enactment of the Act and will apply to individuals appointed or employed as supervisors. Each individual employed as a supervisor on the effective date must complete the required training programs. The amendments require completion of training programs within 3 years of enactment and every 3 years thereafter for appointed or employed supervisors. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCIES. Management competencies are defined for supervisors in the federal government, with guidance issued by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management on expected competencies. Agencies are required to assess competency based on the OPM model. The competency model requires agencies to assess supervisors' overall competency, develop a training program to address identified issues, and measure the program's effectiveness. Agencies must submit annual reports on their progress in implementing these requirements. Technical amendments are made to the table of sections in the United States Code. The text amends section 4304(b)(3) of title 5, United States Code by replacing "section 4305" with "section 4306" in regulations related to management competencies.
